edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Facts

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Facts

  • public class Facts
extends java.lang.Object
    The Fact interface provides a way for the programmer to store per-level, per-session, and per-game (persistent) information about the game. As an example, in a game of golf, one could use per-level to track the current number of strokes, use per-session to track the score across all 18 holes, and per-game to track the player's high score. One might argue that it's easier to create fields inside of some of the game classes to handle this role. However, doing so is (a) confusing for novices, and (b) risky if the programmer isn't completely certain about the lifecycle of the object. Using Facts takes a bit more code, but in the end it's easier.

    • Method Detail

      • getLevelFact

        public static int getLevelFact(java.lang.String factName,
                               int defaultVal)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current level. If no such fact exists, defaultVal will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        defaultVal - The default value to use if the fact cannot be found
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putLevelFact

        public static void putLevelFact(java.lang.String factName,
                                int factValue)
        Save a fact about the current level. If the factName has already been used for this level, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • getSessionFact

        public static int getSessionFact(java.lang.String factName,
                                 int defaultVal)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current game session. If no such fact exists, -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        defaultVal - The default value to use if the fact cannot be found
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putSessionFact

        public static void putSessionFact(java.lang.String factName,
                                  int factValue)
        Save a fact about the current game session. If the factName has already been used for this game session, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • getGameFact

        public static int getGameFact(java.lang.String factName,
                              int defaultVal)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current game session. If no such fact exists, defaultVal will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        defaultVal - The value to return if the fact does not exist
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putGameFact

        public static void putGameFact(java.lang.String factName,
                               int factValue)
        Save a fact about the current game session. If the factName has already been used for this game session, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • getLevelActor

        public static Actor getLevelActor(java.lang.String actorName)
        Look up an Actor that was stored for the current level. If no such Actor exists, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        actorName - The name used to store the Actor
        Returns:
        The last Actor stored with this name

      • putLevelActor

        public static void putLevelActor(java.lang.String actorName,
                                 Actor actor)
        Save a Actor from the current level. If the actorName has already been used for this level, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        actorName - The name for the Actor being saved
        actor - The Actor that is the fact being saved
